DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior Chronic Hepatic Disease or Disorder Eligibility Determination Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response related to the eligibility of a patient for enrollment onto a clinical trial based on their diagnosis of prior chronic hepatic disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior Chronic Hepatic Disease or Disorder Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to eligibility of patient for prior chronic hepatic disease (e.g., chronic active hepatitis, cirrhosis).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Prior Chronic Hepatic Disease or Disorder Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A disease or condition that persists or progresses over a long period of time.:Refers to the liver.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.
Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NSABP CRF:National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have known cirrh
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known cirrhosis or chronic HBV or HVC infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known clinically significant liver disease, including active viral, alcoholic, or other hepatitis; cirrhosis; fatty liver; and inherited liver disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of any chronic hepatitis including alcoholic, non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH), drug related, autoimmune, chronic viral positive tests for hepatitis B virus surface antigen (HBsAg), hepatitis B core antibody (anti-HBc) in the absence of hepatitis B surface antibody (anti-HBs), or a positive hepatitis C (HCV) viral load?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection, has patient either been treated or is on suppressive therapy (as indicated), and HBV viral load is undetectable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known clinically significant liver disease, including active viral, alcoholic, or other hepatitis; cirrhosis; fatty liver/NAFLD/NASH; and inherited liver disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has evidence of chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection, the HBV viral load must be undetectable on suppressive therapy, if indicated?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have ongoing viral or drug induced liver injury, including active chronic HCV, chronic active hepatitis B, clinically known alcoholic liver disease, non-alcoholic steatohepatitis, non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, primary biliary cirrhosis, other cirrhosis of the liver, history of hepatic encephalopathy, or portal hypertension?

DataElement.changeDescription: 9608_Theradex_09.12.14_ghd 03-09-2018 fixed line control character in question text DW
